title: Tips for Simple KDP Low-Content Research Using Publisher Rocket + How to Make Your Book Stand Out!

tactics.name: Keyword Niche Down
tactics.description: Start with broad keywords, filter by search volume and competition, then refine with specific modifiers.
steps: Use Publisher Rocket's keyword search tool with general terms like 'coloring book'.
Filter results by estimated Amazon searches (green) and low competitive score (yellow).
Refine keywords with modifiers like 'for kids' or 'cute dogs' to find underserved niches.
caveats: Avoid overly broad terms like 'log books' without specific modifiers
source_quotes: 'I like to start with a really general keyword and niche it down from there'

tactics.name: Competitor Analysis with Publisher Rocket
tactics.description: Use Publisher Rocket to identify top-performing books in a niche and analyze their features to differentiate your own product.
steps: Check BSR and review counts of competing titles
Evaluate cover design and interior layout
Identify unique selling propositions (USPs) like hardcover options or color interiors
caveats: May fail if niche is oversaturated
source_quotes: this one has a BSR in the 500 000 which is all right not amazing but um still definitely making sales

heuristics.name: Low-Competition Niche Filter
heuristics.condition: If competitive score is yellow (moderate) and Amazon searches are green (high), prioritize
source_quotes: 'less competitive is better because that means your book will have a higher chance of ranking'

heuristics.name: Low-Review Niche Opportunity
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize niches with untapped demand
source_quotes: could it be a better layout could it be offering more pages

claims.statement: Books with 1,000 or fewer Amazon search results have better ranking potential
source_quotes: 'my sweet spot is around a thousand... anything at about 1,000 results or fewer is where you want to be'

claims.statement: Funny or edgy covers with swear words can drive sales in niche markets
source_quotes: covers with swear words tend to do really well

niche_patterns.example: coloring book + cute dogs + for kids
niche_patterns.description: Combine core identity with specific attributes and targeted use cases to create unique niches
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Balances broad appeal with specific targeting to reduce competition
source_quotes: 'I would then go to amazon.com... type in that keyword so I can learn more about it'

niche_patterns.example: truck drivers + logbook needs + professional design
niche_patterns.description: Target specific audience pain points with tailored solutions
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Addresses clear needs while differentiating from generic options
source_quotes: this one has a BSR in the 500 000 which is all right not amazing but um still definitely making sales
